title: (x) Arkitip magazine nameplate - hand done by Michael Leon {Felipe B Lima}
content:
I was wondering if anybody knew the name of the typeface used in the “arkitip” on the magazine cover that is attached below. A friend told me that it could be Romany, a copyright free font made by Dover Books, but I was looking to see if there is anything else you guys might think of.

any help would be greatly appreciated.

[http://www.commonwealthstacks.com/product\_details/2arkcover.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/www.commonwealthstacks.com/product_details/2arkcover.jpg "http://www.commonwealthstacks.com/product\_details/2arkcover.jpg")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2arkcover.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/typophile.com/files/2arkcover.jpg) | 24.38 KB |

 [‹ (x) Oracle logo - custom designed {Marten F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36357 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Sink Swim" condensed grotesque - Alternate Gothic No. Two {Akira} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36946 "Go to next forum topic")
author: alexhb

comments.content: the scripty looking stuff is probably hand-rendered by the illustrator. my guess.

It’s hand done by Michael Leon who used to do a clothing/product line called [Commonwealth Stacks](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/www.commonwealthstacks.com/).

Here are some other examples of it:  
 [http://www.commonwealthstacks.com/womens/womens.script.ivory.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/www.commonwealthstacks.com/womens/womens.script.ivory.jpg)  
 [http://www.commonwealthstacks.com/product\_details/2skullboard.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071118040524/http:/www.commonwealthstacks.com/product_details/2skullboard.jpg)
